intro: Polymeria calycina var. mollis, commonly known as the softleaf chia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. The seeds of this plant are edible and have been used for culinary and medicinal purposes by indigenous peoples.
